column9: It took about 4 -5 days and I could feel the old me coming back - very surprised wieght stable - mood improving -no notable effects other than more energy - will write again in next 10 days

column2: Sofar, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My provider added 25 mcg of liothyronine to my  levothyroxine because I wasn't responding as well as she thought I should be to the T4 alone. After several weeks of hyper symptoms, I fought through it and I have now stabilized. The worst side effects were restless leg syndrome, palpitations, racing thoughts/anxiety, and loose bowels. All of that has stabilized, and I take both my meds right before bed. Big difference in quality of life issues.

column2: debbiesavarese, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it has made my muscles very weak & a great amount of weight loss

column2: Lynn G, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was put on this medication to increase my seratonin levels, as an alternative to adding more SNRI type medications, as it's considered an alternative therapy when weight-neutral options are needed.  It has really helped with my fatigue issues, as well as my overall happiness.  Initially, I had some sensitivity issues, but after 3 days or so I adjusted.  Each increase causes a recurrence and headaches, but we are treading lightly for that reason.  I have some digestive upset as well, but simple nausea medications combat this easily.

column9: I have used this medicine for over 6 months and had to up it a couple of times. i take generic synthroid also. I have lost 14 pounds this year and gotten off of anti anxiety meds.  I doing much better.

column1: T3 Suppression for Thyroid Function Test
column2: JAB139@AOL.YAHOO, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I STARTED TO TAKE THIS MEDICATION THREE WEEKS AGO. I AM BIPOLAR 1 AND DEVELOPED SEVERE HYPOIRRITABILTY. DR. TOLD ME TO REDUCE THE MEDICATION THAT I AM TAKEN CALLED CELEXA. THE COMBINATION OF TAKEN THE CELEXA AND THE LIOTHYRONINE SENT ME IN TO A TAIL SPIN. HOWEVER REDUCING THE CELEXA TO ONLY 10 MGS INSTEAD OF 20 HAS MADE ALL THE DIFFERENCE. I HAVE'NT FELT THIS BALANCED IN OVER 3 WEEKS. MOODS KEPT CYCLING IN A VERY ERATIC WAY. ONCE I REDUCED THE ANTIDEPRESSENT CYLEXA I BECAME MORE STABILIZED.

column2: JoeEstelle, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have Stage 3 papillary cancer.  All thyroids have been removed.  Just started on Synthroid and wanted to offer my one week usage.  I have not experienced any ill effects as of yet and hope none occur.  I was on a low-iodine diet for 2-weeks prior to this followed my 150 mCI of I-131, so I may be seeing some false positives.  Especially since I am now eating a normal diet.

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I take 4 of the 5MCG tablets a day (all at the same time).  I didn't think they worked at all until I stopped taking them for a month.  Mood swings, headaches, and all the problems I had forgotten I had return.  I have not had any dizzyness or reaction to this drug.

column2: abby, 65-74 (Patient)
column9: I was on it for 6 days and ended up in the ER when my heart rate went up to 120 and didn't come down. Be very careful when taking this medication.

column2: PMelick, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have palpitations from using it and my BP goes way higher than usual. I feel I can't get a full breath of air.

column2: Jay, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had problems since aug 02 when my daughter was born. I was 22. Lots of sypmtoms!!!  In 04 Dr tested my hormones.  Adrenal Gland Disorder. Progesterone was prescribed. Helped for about 6mnths. Upped dosage. Not much help. I dont take it any more. In 09 was having new and different symptoms. Very itchy hands and feet. Telling Dr about them. He said lets try something diff. I have been thru alot of meds. I was put on LIOTHYRONINE. In about 2 weeks my biggest symptom was gone! YAHOO! I take 1 in morn and 1 in afternoon (if i remember).  Now theres a diff symptom, my skin crawls and tingles in pathes and now its getting to the point that it is painfull instead of just annoying. Kinda like my skin is on fire. It happens only on my waist,butt, thighs and feet. I tell my boyfriend not to touch those areas.  It will last for about 3 days sometimes. I dont know what to do or if this is from the meds or just another symptom among the others. If I stop this med my yeast and bacterial infections will come back! Not an option. Any one heard of such symptoms?
